title: Ecological Training Design and Jump Performance Analysis Based on Competitive Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Kinesiology and Data Analysis Concepts
context.additional_context: Education for practitioners in the field of sports science.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of performance constraints (individual, environmental, task) on jump performance by analyzing competitive environments.
Learners can design training scenarios resembling actual competitions by applying ecological constraints theory.
Learners can evaluate interactive elements of jump movements through systemic thinking and propose data-driven improvement strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
